body.p:
Cassville V. a
Headquarters 82th 2nd Dec 20th (62)
Govrnor
Dear Sir

from My personal Knowlege of the Western part of Virginia (Haveing Been raised amongst the Mountains) and the Habits and Characteristics of its people as well as My more recent observations I am Well convinced that Mounted troops are Much more Efficient and and Servicable then Infantry, that one Batallion of the Natives of those Natives Hills and Vallys Well Mounted and Some under a Good Leader Would do more to Chase out those rebble thiefs and Murderers than five Batallions of Infantry the Bearer of this Lieut James. D. McBride of the fifth Virginia is at this time Endeavouring to organize such a force those who know Him Well say that He is Well qualified for the very Laudable undertaking and He is very popular With all those persons Encouraging the Noble Work I think that you would do no Better than Extend to him your patronage and Influence

yours truely
Samuel Orr Lieut Col 84th Ind

Head Qrs 84' Ind Vol Infty-
Decr 20" 1862

The within Statement has my full Endorsement.
N. Trusler Col
Comdg 84" Regt Ind Vol
Infty

I have been personally acquainted with Lieut Jas.D. McBride 5th Va Vol Infy. for a number of years, and can cheerfully recommend him as one truly worthy the position asked for, and will if placed in command of a Battalion of Cavalry do good service in the Valley of Big Sandy and Western Virginia, my personal knowledge of his abilities as a military man and a thorough energetic business man in every particular, gives me the assurance in recommending him highly

Very Respectfully
G. M Crall
Major Condg 1st Squadron
O. V. Cavalry

Louisa, Ky
Decr 21st 1862
Moore Laban T & others
Recommending James D McBride as commander of a Battalion of Cavalry for home guard purposes in the Sandy Valley.

5 Inclosures }
Recd A G. O Decr 1862.
